name: Nuclear Fusion Reactor
description: A device that generates energy by fusing atomic nuclei.

name: Fusion Fuel
description: The material used in nuclear fusion reactions.

name: Plasma
description: The state of matter in fusion reactors.

name: Magnetic Confinement
description: A method for containing plasma using magnetic fields.

name: Tokamak
description: A device for achieving controlled nuclear fusion.

name: Spacecraft
description: A vehicle designed for travel in space.

name: Rocket Engine
description: An engine that produces thrust by expelling mass.

name: Rocket Fuel
description: The propellant used in rocket engines.

name: Space Station
description: A habitable structure in orbit around a planet.

name: Space Elevator
description: A structure for transporting materials to space.

name: Solar Sail
description: A propulsion method using radiation pressure from stars.

name: Ion Drive
description: An efficient propulsion system using ionized particles.

name: Orbital Habitat
description: A living space in orbit around a planet.

name: Space Colony
description: A self-sustaining settlement in space.

name: Terraforming
description: The process of making a planet habitable.

name: Atmospheric Processor
description: A device for modifying planetary atmospheres.

name: Planetary Mining
description: Extracting resources from other planets.

name: Asteroid Mining
description: Extracting resources from asteroids.

name: Space Refinery
description: A facility for processing materials in space.

name: Zero Gravity Manufacturing
description: Production in microgravity environments.

name: Advanced Materials
description: Materials with superior properties.

name: Carbon Nanotube
description: An extremely strong and lightweight material.

name: Graphene
description: A single layer of carbon atoms with remarkable properties.

name: Metamaterial
description: A material with properties not found in nature.

name: Self-Healing Material
description: A material that can repair itself.

name: Quantum Computer
description: A computer that uses quantum mechanical phenomena.

name: Quantum Processor
description: A processor that uses quantum bits.

name: Quantum Entanglement
description: A phenomenon used in quantum computing.

name: Quantum Communication
description: Communication using quantum mechanics.

name: Quantum Cryptography
description: Encryption using quantum principles.

name: Antimatter
description: Matter composed of antiparticles.

name: Antimatter Reactor
description: A reactor that uses antimatter for energy.

name: Antimatter Storage
description: A method for safely storing antimatter.

name: Energy Shield
description: A protective barrier generated by technology.

name: Force Field
description: A field that can block or redirect objects.

name: Warp Drive
description: A theoretical propulsion system for faster-than-light travel.

name: Hyperdrive
description: An advanced propulsion system for interstellar travel.

name: Stargate
description: A portal for instantaneous travel between locations.

name: Wormhole
description: A theoretical shortcut through spacetime.

name: Interstellar Communication
description: Communication across vast distances in space.

name: Exoplanet
description: A planet outside our solar system.

name: Exoplanet Survey
description: A systematic search for planets around other stars.

name: Alien Life
description: Life forms from other worlds.

name: Xenobiology
description: The study of alien life forms.

name: Universal Translator
description: A device for translating any language.

name: Genetic Engineering
description: Modifying the genetic code of organisms.

name: Cloning
description: Creating identical copies of organisms.

name: Cyborg
description: A being with both biological and artificial parts.

name: Neural Interface
description: A connection between the brain and computers.

name: Post-Human
description: An entity that has transcended human limitations.
